gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: WB or Water bodies is a 10-day synthesis product that detects water bodies over Africa. The product is a fusion of the former VGT4Africa Small Water Bodies and seasonality (SWB), the Global Water Watch (GWW) and a Permanent Water mask (PW) derived from Shuttle Radar Topography Mission (SRTM) and Modis water mask (MOD44W). The WB products are produced by the VEGETATION image processing center (CTIV) at VITO.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This product is first designed to fit the requirements of the Core Information Services of the geoland2 project. It can be also useful for all applications related to the environment monitoring with a priority over arid, semi-arid and sub-humid regions. The collection provides continental products.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: “WB products were provided by the Global component of the Land Service of the Copernicus programme of (or funded by) the European Commission. The algorithm was originally developed in the framework of the FP7/Geoland2 (grant agreement no 218795) and FP6/VGT4africa by the University of Louvain-La-Neuve, JRCand VITO. It is generated from the SPOT VEGETATION data under copyright Cnes and distribution by VITO.”

gmd:positionName.gco:CharacterString: Copernicus Global Land Service Help Desk

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: European Commission Directorate-General for Enterprise and Industry
European Commission Directorate-General Joint Research Center

gmd:name.gco:CharacterString: EC DG-JRC Institute for Environment and Sustainability

gmd:fileDescription.gco:CharacterString: Quicklook at 16 times reduced resolution of WB dataset.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: (d) the confidentiality of commercial or industrial information, where such confidentiality is provided for by national or Community law to protect a legitimate economic interest, including the public interest in maintaining statistical confidentiality and tax secrecy.

gmd:specification.gco:CharacterString: Standard PKZIP compatible Unix/Linux ZIP format

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Harmonized Data Access (WEkEO) API is a REST interface allowing users to subset and download WEkEO datasets.

gmd:fees.gco:CharacterString: Free by ftp and Eumetcast; cost of medium by DvD or tape

gmd:orderingInstructions.gco:CharacterString: Products can be downloaded on-line via HTTP (or FTP) or can be received through EUMETCast satellite reception in Africa.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Register to receive products via Eumetcast

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Validation results conform CEOS LPV guidelines
INSPIRE Data Specification on orthoimagery - Guidelines

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: The algorithm is based on a fusion of three existing products as an attempt to get the 'best available products'. The VGT4Africa (SWB) is based on a method using different thresholds for the Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) and the Normalized Difference Water Index (NDWI). The Global Watch Water (GWW) is based on a method taking 10-daily Mean Composites, performing a colorametric transformation from RGB to HSV color space and using different thresholds for the Hue component and the reflectance in the middle infra-red (MIR). The Permanent Water (PW) is based on the MODIS Water Mask (MOD44W) and Shuttle Radar Topography Missino (SRTM) to generate a consistent permanent detectin product over the African continent. The input data are the daily reflectance source data (for GWW layer) and 10-daily refelectance sources (for SWB layer) measured by the SPOT-VGT sensor as provided by the SPOT-VEGETATION CTIV.
